content: shannon s slouchy hat by kirsten spitzer this slouchy hat is a fun quick project with subtle texture throughout one size fits the average female materials needed 100 g 220 yards worsted weight yarn the hat modeled next round k94 p10 shows paton s classic wool i did not use the whole ball next round p36 k68 size 5 us 3 75 mm 16 inch circular knitting needles knit the next 5 rounds size 7 us 4 5 mm 16 inch circular knitting needles next round k10 p44 k50 5 size 7 us 4 5 mm double pointed knitting needles knit the next 3 rounds stitch marker next round k60 p40 k4 tapestry needle knit the next 5 rounds next round k4 p48 k52 stitch abbreviations knit 1 more round then begin decreasing k knit please note that when the hat will no longer fit on the circular needles you will need to switch to double sided needles by k2tog knit 2 together evenly dividing the remaining stitches onto 4 double sided needles p purl round 1 k6 k2tog repeat around k1f&b knit into the front and back of the next stitch- round 2 knit around increases by 1 round 3 k5 k2tog repeat around round 4 k32 p36 k10 pattern round 5 k4 k2tog repeat around with the size 5 16 inch circular needles cast on 96 stitches round 6 knit around place a marker then join being careful not to twist round7 k3 k2tog repeat around knit 6 rounds round 8 knit around next 9 rounds k2 p2 repeat around round 9 k2 k2tog repeat around round 10 knit around switch to the size 7 16 inch circular needles round 11 k1 k2tog repeat around k9 rounds round 12 k2tog repeat around next round-increase round k11 k1f&b repeat around you should have 104 stitches after the increase round finish next round k22 p60 k22 cut yarn and pull through the remaining stitches gather knit the next 7 rounds together and bring the tail into the inside of the hat and fasten next round k45 p59 off weave in ends knit the next 4 rounds
